page.title: 05Farming in Woodplumpton.
page.content: The land around {Woodplumpton} is mainly sown and fertilised grassland used for {pasture} or for cutting as grass,silage or hay.The type of farm in the area varies.Some are small with an acreage between 36-44.Others are larger and expanding with an acreage between 150-200. {Crow Trees Farm} is a small {dairy} farm {35 acres}.The main crops are silage and hay used to feed farm animals.There is a herd of 24-28 milking cows and 4 dry cows which include Fresian, Ayrshire Holstien and a few cross breeds.Eight calves and sixteen bullocks have been reared by the farmer.The maximum output of {milk} 120 gallons per day which all goes to the Milk Marketing Board.There is a milking parlour which hold six cows. Cattle are sent to Preston Market (continued page 6)
